admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF021356-AGRICULTURAL SERVICES PROJECT,TF029488-PHRD-PUBLIC FINANCE MANAGEMENT
            PROJECT (PFMP)

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings show satisfactory
            outcomes, highly likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Among the lessons
            learned, it is reinforced that strong government commitments
            enhances the chances for success, as demonstrated by the
            pro-active implementation of public finance management
            reforms; that a focused, and well defined program delivers
            positive results, shown particularly in the Treasury
            component, carefully, and functionally designed prior to an
            established computerization, thus ensuring an effective
            implementation; and, that flexibility in the design of
            components (accomplished in close collaboration between the
            Bank and counterparts) also succeeded in enabling
            discussions on different public finance management systems,
            and on understanding the full range of requirements. It is
            also worth noting that the continuity of project staff,
            eased communications with participating institutions, and an
            efficient project administration.
